conjugations.exampleSentence: Io vado a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I go to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu vai a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You go home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lui va al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He goes to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi andiamo a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We go for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi andate a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You go shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro vanno a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They go to the theater

tenses.description: Used to describe actions happening now, general truths, or habitual actions. This is the most commonly used tense in Italian.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io andavo a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I was going to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu andavi a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You were going home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lui andava al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He was going to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi andavamo a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We were going for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi andavate a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You were going shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro andavano a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They were going to the theater

tenses.description: Used to describe ongoing, repeated, or habitual actions in the past. Also used for background information in storytelling.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io andrò a scuola domani
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I will go to school tomorrow

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu andrai a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will go home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lui andrà al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He will go to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi andremo a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We will go for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi andrete a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will go shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro andranno a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They will go to the theater

tenses.description: Used to express future actions, predictions, or intentions. Often used with time expressions like 'domani' (tomorrow) or 'la settimana prossima' (next week).

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io sono andato a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I have gone to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu sei andato a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You have gone home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lui è andato al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He has gone to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi siamo andati a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We have gone for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi siete andati a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You have gone shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro sono andati a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They have gone to the theater

tenses.description: Used to express completed actions in the past that have a connection to the present. This is the most common past tense in spoken Italian.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io andai a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I went to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu andasti a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You went home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lui andò al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He went to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi andammo a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We went for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi andaste a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You went shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro andarono a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They went to the theater

tenses.description: Used primarily in formal and literary Italian to narrate completed past events. Also used in southern Italy in spoken language.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io ero andato a scuola prima che piovesse
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had gone to school before it rained

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu eri andato a casa prima che venissi
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had gone home before I came

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lui era andato al cinema prima che arrivassimo
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He had gone to the cinema before we arrived

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi eravamo andati a passeggio prima che facesse buio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had gone for a walk before it got dark

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi eravate andati a fare la spesa prima della chiusura
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had gone shopping before closing

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro erano andati a teatro prima dello spettacolo
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had gone to the theater before the show

tenses.description: Used to express actions that were completed before another past action. Often used in storytelling to establish a sequence of past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Appena fui andato a scuola, piovve
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as I had gone to school, it rained

conjugations.exampleSentence: Appena fosti andato a casa, venni
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as you had gone home, I came

conjugations.exampleSentence: Appena fu andato al cinema, arrivammo
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as he had gone to the cinema, we arrived

conjugations.exampleSentence: Appena fummo andati a passeggio, fece buio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as we had gone for a walk, it got dark

conjugations.exampleSentence: Appena foste andati a fare la spesa, il negozio chiuse
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as you had gone shopping, the store closed

conjugations.exampleSentence: Appena furono andati a teatro, lo spettacolo cominciò
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as they had gone to the theater, the show began

tenses.description: Used in formal and literary Italian to express an action that was completed immediately before another past action. Rarely used in modern Italian.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io sarò andato a scuola domani
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I will have gone to school tomorrow

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu sarai andato a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will have gone home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lui sarà andato al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He will have gone to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi saremo andati a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We will have gone for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi sarete andati a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will have gone shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro saranno andati a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They will have gone to the theater

tenses.description: Used to express actions that will be completed before another future action. Often used with time expressions like 'domani' (tomorrow).

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io andrei a scuola se avessi tempo
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I would go to school if I had time

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu andresti a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You would go home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lui andrebbe al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He would go to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi andremmo a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We would go for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi andreste a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You would go shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro andrebbero a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They would go to the theater

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical situations, polite requests, or actions that would happen under certain conditions. Often used with 'se' (if) clauses.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io sarei andato a scuola se avessi potuto
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I would have gone to school if I could have

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu saresti andato a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You would have gone home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lui sarebbe andato al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He would have gone to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi saremmo andati a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We would have gone for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi sareste andati a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You would have gone shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro sarebbero andati a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They would have gone to the theater

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical past actions or regrets about things that didn't happen. Often used with 'se' (if) clauses referring to the past.

conjugations.exampleSentence: È necessario che io vada a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I must go to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voglio che tu vada a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I want you to go home

conjugations.exampleSentence: È necessario che lui vada al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He must go to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: È necessario che noi andiamo a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We must go for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: È necessario che voi andiate a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You must go shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: È necessario che loro vadano a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They must go to the theater

tenses.description: Used in dependent clauses after certain expressions of opinion, doubt, emotion, or necessity. Often used after 'è necessario che', 'voglio che', etc.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Era necessario che io andassi a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had to go to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Volevo che tu andassi a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I wanted you to go home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Era necessario che lui andasse al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He had to go to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Era necessario che noi andassimo a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had to go for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Era necessario che voi andaste a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had to go shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Era necessario che loro andassero a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had to go to the theater

tenses.description: Used in formal and literary Italian after the same triggers as present subjunctive, but referring to past events. Rarely used in modern spoken Italian.

conjugations.exampleSentence: È necessario che io sia andato a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I must have gone to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voglio che tu sia andato a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I want you to have gone home

conjugations.exampleSentence: È necessario che lui sia andato al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He must have gone to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: È necessario che noi siamo andati a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We must have gone for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: È necessario che voi siate andati a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You must have gone shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: È necessario che loro siano andati a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They must have gone to the theater

tenses.description: Used in dependent clauses after expressions of doubt, emotion, or necessity when referring to a completed action in the past.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Era necessario che io fossi andato a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had to have gone to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Volevo che tu fossi andato a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I wanted you to have gone home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Era necessario che lui fosse andato al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He had to have gone to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Era necessario che noi fossimo andati a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had to have gone for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Era necessario che voi foste andati a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had to have gone shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Era necessario che loro fossero andati a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had to have gone to the theater

tenses.description: Used in formal and literary Italian after the same triggers as other subjunctive tenses, but referring to actions completed before another past action.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Vai a scuola!
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Go to school!

conjugations.exampleSentence: Andiamo a passeggio!
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Let's go for a walk!

conjugations.exampleSentence: Andate a fare la spesa!
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Go shopping!

tenses.description: Used to give commands, orders, or instructions. Only exists for the second person (tu, noi, voi). The subject pronoun is omitted.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voglio andare a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I want to go to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Devo andare a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I must go home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Posso andare al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I can go to the cinema

tenses.description: The base form of the verb, used after modal verbs, prepositions, and in many other constructions.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dopo essere andato a scuola, ho studiato
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: After having gone to school, I studied

conjugations.exampleSentence: Prima di essere andato a casa, ho lavorato
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Before having gone home, I worked

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dopo essere andato al cinema, ho cenato
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: After having gone to the cinema, I had dinner

tenses.description: Used to express actions that were completed before another action. Often used after modal verbs in the past.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Una persona andante
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: A walking person

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il treno andante
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: The going train

conjugations.exampleSentence: La macchina andante
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: The going car

tenses.description: Used as an adjective or in progressive constructions. In modern Italian, it's mainly used as an adjective.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sono andato a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I have gone to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: È andata a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She has gone home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sono andati al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They have gone to the cinema

tenses.description: Used to form compound tenses and as an adjective. Must agree in gender and number with the subject.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sto andando a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I am going to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Stai andando a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You are going home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sta andando al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He is going to the cinema

tenses.description: Used to express ongoing actions, often with 'stare' to form the present continuous tense.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Essendo andato a scuola, ho studiato
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Having gone to school, I studied

conjugations.exampleSentence: Essendo andata a casa, ha riposato
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Having gone home, she rested

conjugations.exampleSentence: Essendo andati al cinema, hanno cenato
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Having gone to the cinema, they had dinner

tenses.description: Used to express actions that were completed before another action. Rarely used in modern Italian.
